title: The Birth of a Nation
description: Two brothers, Phil and Ted Stoneman, visit their friends in Piedmont, South Carolina: the Camerons. This friendship is affected by the Civil War, as the Stonemans and the Camerons must join up opposite armies.

title: Intolerance
description: The story of a poor young woman, separated by prejudice from her husband and baby, is interwoven with tales of intolerance from history.

title: Broken Blossoms
description: A frail waif, abused by her brutal boxer father in London's seedy Limehouse District, is befriended by a sensitive Chinese immigrant.

title: The Immigrant
description: The Tramp comes to the United States and is accused of theft while on the voyage across the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Cabiria
description: In ancient times, a Roman noblewoman and her slave are shipwrecked and captured by pirates, leading to a series of adventures involving Hannibal and Maciste.

title: Les Vampires
description: An intrepid reporter and his loyal friend battle a bizarre secret society of criminals known as The Vampires.

title: The Cheat
production_studio: Jesse L. Lasky Feature Play Company
description: A spoiled society woman embezzles money from a charity and turns to a wealthy Asian ivory merchant for help, with disastrous consequences.

title: Gertie the Dinosaur
description: A pioneering animated film featuring a dinosaur named Gertie who performs tricks for the live-action McCay.

title: The Tramp
description: The Tramp finds the girl of his dreams and works on a family farm to help defend it from criminals.

title: L'Inferno
description: Loosely adapted from Dante's Divine Comedy and inspired by the illustrations of Gustave Doré, this is the first full-length Italian feature film.

title: Fantômas - In the Shadow of the Guillotine
description: The first in a series of five films about the arch-criminal Fantômas and the determined Inspector Juve.

title: Shoulder Arms
description: A raw recruit in World War I dreams of being a hero, capturing the Kaiser and winning the girl.

title: A Dog's Life
description: The Tramp befriends a stray dog and together they survive in the city slums.

title: Easy Street
description: The Tramp becomes a policeman to reform a rough neighborhood and win the heart of a mission worker.

title: Tillie's Punctured Romance
description: A con man convinces a wealthy farm girl to steal her father's money and run away to the city, in the first feature-length comedy.

title: Judith of Bethulia
description: A beautiful widow charms the Assyrian general besieging her city in order to save her people.

title: The Student of Prague
description: A poor student sells his reflection to a sorcerer for wealth, only to be haunted by his own doppelgänger.

title: The Perils of Pauline
description: Young Pauline is left a lot of money when her wealthy uncle dies, but her uncle's secretary tries to kill her to get the fortune.

title: Regeneration
description: An orphan rises to become a gang leader, but finds his life changed when he meets a settlement worker.

title: The Cameraman's Revenge
description: A cameraman takes revenge on an unfaithful beetle couple in this pioneering stop-motion animated short using dead insects.

title: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
description: Captain Nemo takes a band of Americans prisoner on his submarine, but they soon discover his quest for vengeance against the world.

title: Civilization
description: A pacifist submarine commander refuses to fire on a civilian ocean liner and is possessed by the spirit of Jesus to preach peace to a war-torn nation.

title: Hell's Hinges
description: A weak minister and his sister come to a rough western town, where a local gunslinger finds redemption through the sister's faith.

title: The Poor Little Rich Girl
description: A neglected rich girl is given an overdose of sleeping medicine by servants and hallucinates a fantasy world.

title: Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm
description: A high-spirited girl is sent to live with her two strict aunts, winning over the town with her charm.

title: A Little Princess
description: A wealthy girl is relegated to servitude at a boarding school when her father loses his fortune and is presumed dead.

title: The Cure
description: An alcoholic checks into a health spa, bringing along a trunk full of alcohol which causes chaos.

title: Mickey
description: A tomboy orphan raised in a mining camp is sent to live with her wealthy aunt in New York, where she shakes up their society.

title: Stella Maris
description: Mary Pickford plays dual roles: a beautiful, paralyzed rich girl and an ugly, abused orphan, both of whom love the same man.

title: The Blue Bird
description: Two children seek the Blue Bird of Happiness, aided by the Fairy Bérylune and various magical spirits.

title: J'accuse
description: A romantic drama set against the horrors of World War I, featuring a sequence where the dead rise from the battlefield to see if their sacrifice was in vain.

title: South
description: A pioneering documentary record of Ernest Shackleton's ill-fated Endurance expedition to Antarctica.

title: Male and Female
description: A British aristocrat and her butler are shipwrecked on a desert island, where the social hierarchy is reversed.

title: Blind Husbands
description: An Austrian lieutenant attempts to seduce the neglected wife of an American doctor while they are vacationing in the Alps.

title: The Oyster Princess
description: A spoiled American oyster heiress demands to marry a real prince, but a case of mistaken identity leads to comedic chaos.

title: The Doll
description: A shy bachelor, forced to marry to inherit a fortune, buys a lifelike mechanical doll to pose as his wife, unaware that the doll is actually a real woman.

title: Sir Arne's Treasure
description: In 16th-century Sweden, three Scottish mercenaries murder a wealthy family for treasure, unwittingly sparing a daughter who falls in love with one of them.

title: Different from the Others
description: A landmark film in gay history, it tells the story of a violinist who is blackmailed for his homosexuality and fights against the German law criminalizing it.

title: True Heart Susie
description: A simple country girl secretly sacrifices her own happiness to help the boy she loves succeed, only to see him marry someone else.

title: Daddy-Long-Legs
description: A mysterious benefactor pays for an orphan girl to attend college, but she must never know his identity.

title: Frankenstein
description: The very first motion picture adaptation of Mary Shelley's novel about a scientist who creates a monster.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
description: An early silent film adaptation of Charles Dickens' novel set during the French Revolution.

title: Traffic in Souls
production_studio: Independent Moving Pictures Co. of America
description: A pair of sisters unknowingly become targets of a prostitution ring, leading to an expose of white slavery.

title: Cinderella
description: The classic fairy tale of a mistreated stepdaughter who wins the heart of a prince with the help of her fairy godmother.

title: The Italian
description: An Italian immigrant gondolier comes to New York to make his fortune, but finds tragedy in the slums.

title: Carmen
production_studio: Jesse L. Lasky Feature Play Company
description: A gypsy seductress brings about the downfall of a Spanish officer in this silent adaptation of the famous opera.

title: Ask Father
description: A young man tries desperately to get into a busy office to ask the boss for his daughter's hand in marriage.

title: The Rink
description: A bumbling waiter pretends to be a wealthy man to impress a girl at a roller skating rink.

title: Quo Vadis?
description: An early Italian epic depicting the persecution of Christians in Nero's Rome.

title: The Squaw Man
production_studio: Jesse L. Lasky Feature Play Company
description: Generally considered the first feature film shot in Hollywood, depicting a British officer's life in the American West.

title: Bumping Into Broadway
description: A young playwright spends his last cent to pay the rent of a struggling actress, then accidentally ends up gambling at a club.

title: From Hand to Mouth
description: A penniless young man and a waif team up to help a wealthy heiress claim her inheritance.

title: Ingeborg Holm
description: A Swedish drama that sparked social change, depicting a widow who loses her children to the poorhouse system.

title: The Outlaw and His Wife
description: A stranger arrives at a farm and falls in love with the wealthy widow who owns it, but his past as a thief catches up with them.

title: Richard III
description: One of the earliest surviving feature film adaptations of Shakespeare's play about the hunchback king.

title: The Avenging Conscience
description: A man murders his uncle to be with his sweetheart, but is then tormented by guilt and visions, based on works by Edgar Allan Poe.

title: After the Ball
description: An early short film by the pioneer of special effects, Georges Méliès, depicting the aftermath of a party.

title: The Dinosaur and the Missing Link
description: A stop-motion animated short involving cavemen and dinosaurs, created by the man who would later animate King Kong.
